summaryText: What a powerful sermon from Pastor Travis Hearn about moving forward and refusing to be defined by your past! In this incredibly motivational message, Pastor Travis shares a deeply personal approach to overcoming life's challenges through three key strategies: leaving the past behind, continually pressing forward, and transforming your misery into ministry. Drawing from powerful biblical stories like Lot's wife and David's battle with Goliath, PT reminds us that God doesn't just want us to survive our trials - He wants us to TRIUMPH over them! The most profound moment was when Pastor Travis shared his basketball coaching story about 'sucking it up' - a metaphor for spiritual resilience that resonates with anyone who's ever faced seemingly impossible circumstances. He powerfully declares that your deepest pain can become your divine purpose, challenging listeners to stop being victims and start being warriors. The message isn't just about surviving, it's about using every challenge as a launching pad for God's miraculous work in your life. Can you imagine turning your greatest struggle into your most significant testimony? That's exactly what Pastor Travis is calling us to do!
mainPoints: Leave the past in the past

versesMentioned.text: Brothers and sisters, I do not consider myself yet to have taken hold of it. But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead, I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.
Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past. See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way in the wilderness and streams in the wasteland.
But Lot's wife looked back, and she became a pillar of salt.
Remember Lot's wife! Whoever tries to keep their life will lose it, and whoever loses their life will preserve it.
I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I now live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.
We are hard pressed on every side, but not crushed; perplexed, but not in despair; persecuted, but not abandoned; struck down, but not destroyed.
Who comforts us in all our troubles, so that we can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves receive from God.
David ran and stood over him. He took hold of the Philistine's sword and drew it from the sheath and killed him, cutting off his head with the sword.

Monday.scripture: Isaiah 43:18-19: 'Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past. See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it?'
Monday.action: Make a list of three past experiences or thoughts that have been holding you back. Pray over each one, symbolically releasing them to God.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me let go of my past and trust in Your new work in my life. Give me vision to see the fresh path You are creating.

Tuesday.scripture: Philippians 3:13-14: 'But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead, I press on toward the goal'
Tuesday.action: Create a goal map for the next three months. Identify specific steps you'll take to press toward your God-given purpose.
Tuesday.prayer: God, guide my steps and help me press forward with determination. Align my goals with Your divine purpose for my life.

Wednesday.scripture: Galatians 2:20: 'I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me'
Wednesday.focus: Dying to self, living for Christ
Wednesday.action: Spend time reflecting on areas of your life where you're still living for yourself. Journal about how you can surrender these areas to God.
Wednesday.prayer: Lord, help me crucify my selfish desires. Fill me with Your Spirit and help me live fully for Your purposes.

Thursday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 1:4: 'Who comforts us in all our troubles, so that we can comfort those in any trouble'
Thursday.action: Reach out to someone who is going through a similar struggle you've overcome. Share your story of hope and healing.
Thursday.prayer: God, use my past struggles as a platform to bring comfort and hope to others. Help me be a vessel of Your healing.

Friday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 4:8: 'We are hard pressed on every side, but not crushed; perplexed, but not in despair'
Friday.action: List three current challenges you're facing. Next to each, write a declaration of faith about how God is working through them.
Friday.prayer: Father, give me strength to remain resilient. Help me see Your hand at work, even in my most challenging moments.

Saturday.scripture: 1 Samuel 17:51: 'David ran and stood over him... and killed him, cutting off his head with the sword'
Saturday.action: Identify a 'giant' in your life (fear, addiction, doubt). Create a specific strategy for confronting and defeating it with God's help.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, give me the courage of David. Help me face my giants with faith, knowing You are fighting on my behalf.
